channel.title: GameCrashers
channel.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
channel.description: Game Crashers is not your normal video game podcast. We're not here to replace the 1ups or the IGNs or the Kotakunauts of the world. We're here because the video game industry is a crazy place...and some one has to decipher the lunacy that gets posted on the inter-webs every day. Get ready for honest opinions, comedic commentaries, occasionally competent reviews, and partially inebriated hosts and guest stars. We're not you're usual podcast...we're gamecrashers...and we're okay with that.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Because knowing the Contra Code does not make you a better person.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.ALL THE HUNDREDS
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
We know it's been a damn long time between episodes, but we got stuck on a Russian icebreaker filled with crazy ice ghost zombies. True story.
The Rundown: - Rob finally buys the console that shall not be named - Boris makes stuff - Oh...that E3 thing is happening Game of the Week Stupid News: - 38 Studios and Big Huge games are no more CrashCast news - CrashCast v2 (moar bettar!!) Sign off and Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers / Irrational Passions Pre-PAX gathering
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
It's Boston. It's Chinatown. It's two podcasts sitting down in a loud chinese restaurant to stuff their faces and prepare for the crazy that is PAX East. IPP and GC on one podcast. Get hype!
The Rundown: - We test out the TASCAM field recorder in the loudest chinese restaurant we can find. - Al, Joseph, Tony, Evan, Jason, and Rob at one table. - Bedlam.
It's PAX time!!
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Episode PRE-PAX-MILLION!!!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Set this thing to warp factor PAX...because that's all we're going to be talking about for the next few days. And we have more than 2 hosts this time around. How about that sh*t?!?!
The Rundown: - PAX East week - We're going nuts getting ready for the fun that is PAX East - Rob gets another year older - Oh snap!! (29 is my lucky number this year) Game of the Week: - Journey, Twisted Metal, Rage, Batman Arkham City, Binary Domain - F2P gaming now and in the future (at GDC and maybe at PAX East) - Always on DRM still blows - GDC rundown by Mr. Brian - PAX East info, pannels, and games Stupid News: - UK retailer GAME enters administration - Dennis Dyack drops the crazy...again - Priest sells DS loaded with 'child pornography' to family Sign off and Outro
Break Music (ocremix.org) Amorelle - by Radiowar - remixed from "Shenmue"
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.99 - Teh Internet Broke Teh Rob
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
This week's show finds Rob breaking down from 'internet logic', extreme tangents, broken peripherals, and the impending exhaustion/elation of PAX East.
The Rundown: Preamble: Petition to Change the Mass Effect 3 ending Game of the Week: Forza 4, Kinect Head Tracking, Kinect vs Move, First Impressions on Mass Effect 3, Razer Nostromo Keypad Movie Corner: Se7en, Alien 3 (and a planet made...of wood) Emails and Bacon. This week's email word/topic = Shepard (what's your Shepard up to?) Tweet of the Week Contest: Shepard out of bacon Victor Borge, DLC, NPR, and Patent Trolls Closing Thoughts Outro
Break Music: We ramble on for 2 hours...no breaks. Thus, no break music this week.
PAX EAST: We'll be talking about our PAX details on next week's show!!!
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.98 - G-D, Shepard, and Bacon!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
God creates dinosaurs, god destroys dinosaurs, god creates man, man creates Mass Effect, man destroys god, man creates bacon, everyone wins. In that order. F*ck yeah! (Are you emailing us yet?)
The Rundown: Preamble: GDC, Assassin's Creed III, Halo 4, Mass Effect 3 week! Game of the Week: League of Legends, The Darkness II, Goldeneye, SSX, UFC, Syndicate Discussions: War in games, Nostalgia Laser Tag, Mixed Martial Arts Stupid News: - DLC...We're not giving this sh*t away! - Nintendo rejects The Binding of Isaac on 3DS store - Internet blasts Mass Effect for day 1 DLC (among other things) Closing Thoughts (are you emailing us yet?) Outro
Break Music: Battletoads In the Suite Remix - Mazedude
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.97 - Who Builds Your Sh*t?
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
The late George Carlin was an expert about humanity's attachment to lots, and lots, of sh*t. We try to address the same issue with regards to the recent Foxconn/Apple issues in China. I know...deep right?
The Rundown: Preamble: No one cares about the Academy Awards Game of the Week: Mass Effect DLC, LA Noire DLC, Sony 3D Monitor, Darksiders, Dark Souls, Alan Wake Post Break: The "games" are already stacking up in 2012 Stupid News: - Sarcastic Gamer Implodes - Mass Effect and Kinect...a match made (and not much else) - California owes ESA and Lawyers $2m in post Brown VS EMA decision - Foxconn: China and what they make and the human cost Closing Thoughts Outro
Break Music Heroes Fall - HouseTheGrate - Zelda II: The Adventure of Link
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on Twitter, Facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.95 - Your Star Wars Child has Two Mommies
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Well...this episode is releasing a long time ago in a galaxy far far away. We collect the odd and ends of two recordings and slam them into one frankenstein's monster of a podcast. And Jedis. For science. You monster.
The Rundown: Game of the Week: Dragon Age 2, Resistance 3, Skyward Sword, Darksiders (and breaking the game in speed runs), Dark Souls, League of Legends (aka my new addiction). Stupid News: - Family Research Council warns parents about same-sex relationships in Bioware's SWTOR - Sopa/Pipa and what's next (and Megaupload) Tweets of the Week - We poll the GC Twitter base - Microsoft "no used games" new console rumors and its effect on retail/used market Closing Thoughts Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

First up: The Best of 2011 Awards.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.88 Miles Per Hour into GAMES!!!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Roads? Where we're going we don't need roads! Sean waxes poetic on Dead Island, Mr. DSG rocks VVVVVV and Horde, and I dive into Ready Player One...yes, I can read.
The Rundown: Extended Reading: Ready Player One, Warhammer 40k The Founding Game of the Week: Resistance 3, Demon's Souls, VVVVVV, Horde, Dead Island Stupid News: - Diablo III delayed until 2012 - SWTOR dated for 12.20.11 - Father/Son buy back stolen console from guy who stole it - Man creates real life Elder Scrolls Oblivion Tome A New Contest Approaches: What's the one game you've always avoided like the plague? (25% off Origin promo code) Outro

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.87 - Rule #34 "Get New Chartz"
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Um. Excuse me. Your 'chartz' are showing. God this is embarrassing. Uh...I'm just gonna. I'll be throwing up...I mean...I should go.
The Rundown: TGS is without "Guardians" but has plenty of "Sliders" PSVita battery won't last longer than a X-country flight Game of the week: Trackmania 2, World of Tanks, Super Smash Land Resident Evil Game are re-released in HD Stupid News: - Cliffy B thinks Jim Sterling's "8" for Gears 3 ain't all that great - Ben Paddon (Gamejournos.com) gets flack from VGChartz for exposing some shady business practices - Sony adds arbitration clause to TOS for all potential Class Action Suits moving forward Question of the Moment: "Are you excited about Gears of War 3" Upcoming Events Closing Thoughts Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.86'd - Dubstep Hero (PSNSTORES Edition)
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
There's some major "wubwub" action going down on this episode of the 'crashcast' -- Chris Kuspis from PSNStores joins the irregular crew of Trollware and MR.DSG (Troll shot first). In 30 years, we'll make a ton of changes to this show to make it good.
The Rundown: George Lucas hates his fans, hates his imperfect films more, makes changes for Blu-Ray release of SW. Game of the Week: SkyDrift, Escape, Cubixx HD, AC:BroHo, Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga, Bastion, Dead Island, Deus Ex, Warhammer 40K Space Marine Semi-Annual Video Game Report Card Fall/Winter Preview Stupid News: - Dead Island posts dev build to Steam - Nintendo's bulky ass 2nd slider previewed in Famitsu - Fox fears games teaching "liberal agenda" about the environment through fear tactics - Flash title "Tea Party Zombies Must Die" offends targeted Tea Party Conservatives...and it's crap. - Team MEAT vs Zen Studios Tweets of the Week Emails Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.83 - Let's Ban Conyp0rn
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
David, Boris, and Rob go on a magical Conyp0rn adventure. Too bad all such adventures have been subsequently banned. Because everyone knows guns don't kill people, conyp0rns kill people. Right? In other news, DSG is Canadian. That is all.
The Rundown: Resistance 3 Beta Discussion - (a.k.a. Boris' flawed assessment of my video game ability) DSG shows up late and violates our eardrums Unlocks in video games: unfair? broken? Thoughts on playing games for a living Emails in the middle of the show (for a change) What we'll be streaming for Extra Life Boris brings out the 3DS guilt "Ambassador Program" Stupid News: - Oasis singer blames video games for London riots - Swiss to ban Darkness II - Retail copies of BF3 still require Origin - Mass Effect 3 not the last ME game, EA states We give away the Resistance 1/2 pack to our contest winner Closing Thoughts Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.81 - A Double Dose of Daves
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
I was going to name this episode "The Times, They Are A'changin" but that sounds too negative. Sure, there are some changes coming, but they're all good things, and one really crazy thing. We can't say much, but here's a hint: cake...on...face...
The RUNDOWN (It's a shorter episode, but no less chocked full of *CENSORED* and *CENSORED* jokes): - Game of the Week: Professor Layton, Team Fortress 2, Assassin's Creed II & Brotherhood, Ben There Dan That - Boris posits new/used game purchase windows - Rob argues "$10 Pass" is a bad solution and Gamestop is to blame - Very Important GameCrashers Announcements (You'll want to hear this part) - Closing Arguments & Outro
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.80 (A Side) - Meet the Podcast: a discussion topic free-for-all
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
With TF2 going free to play, WoW going free to try, and Steam going insane on sales, we figured we'd join in on the free-for-all and ditch the regular formula and just run down a gigantic list of discussion topics. We're talking one jam-packed podcast!
The Rundown (we talk about a LOT this episode): The Steam Summer Sale Brown VS EMA Industry VS ISPs S.978 "Anti-streaming bill" Namco Bandai sues CDProjektRED over DRM removal in Witcher 2 14min Bioshock Infinite Trailer The Uncharted Movie is still possible Please make a Duke Nukem movie Farcry 3 and Aliens: Colonial Marines Team Bondi / Rockstar friction Planetside 2 officially announced Last Star Fighter / Enders Game / Starship Troopers tangent More anti-streaming bill deliberation The end of Demon's Souls online mode EMAILS OUTRO!
If you like the show be sure to leave us an iTunes review and help us refill our review page! Also be sure to check us out on twitter, facebook, and our home base at retroids.com
Peace...Out!

item.title: GameStoresNation E3 VidCast Part II - Live from the Bethesda Party
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
It's Part II of the epic GameStoresNation video podcast (GameCrashers, PSNation, PSNStores) live from the Bethesda Day 1 after party. With great parties comes seriously horrifying karaoke.
In Part II: More Prey 2 Green Lantern & Captain America Dark Souls Deus Ex: Human Revolution El Shaddai: Ascension of the Metatron PixelJunk Lifelike Our podcast becomes unhinged (like that never happens) Resistance 3 Starhawk What we're excited to see in South hall and on Days 2 and 3 "Deeper and Wider" Batman Arkham City - Catwoman trailer Sly Cooper 4 Bioshock Infinite NHL12 Sony Vita The E3 Lines never end Torchlight 2 Journey Marc Singer of Trendy Entertainment crashes our outro (Dungeon Defenders)
Be sure to check out all of our video from E3 at www.gamecrashers.net See you all next year!

item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
The hosts of GameCrashers, PSNation, and PSNStores descend upon the Bethesda party to discuss the highs and lows of E3. Also, Abbie Heppe (ex-G4, Respawn Community Manager) crashes our show like a pro. Let the booze flow through you!
In Part I: We discuss the Nintendo Press Conference The WiiU (Controller or Console?) Abbie Heppe heckles Josh Rage, Prey 2 (Bethesda)
Check out Part II Also be sure to check out the rest of our E3 coverage at gamecrashers.net

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.78 - Witcher Noire: "OH YEAH" Edition
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
The Macho Man has left this world. Raise your Slim Jims and bow your heads. It's another week of dueling releases that have nothing in common, but sound funny when put together: Witcher 2 and LA Noire. Rapture be damned.
The Rundown - Game of the Week: Witcher 2, LA Noire, Outland, Faultline, Ratchet & Clank Future A Crack in Time, Minecraft, Fable 3, Metal Gear Solid 4
Stupid News: - IGN sells D2D to Gamefly - Zynga sued by Learning Company over Frontierville Oregon Trail - Activision displeased, makes most of MW3 leak - Hellgate London, APB rise from MMO grave as F2P games
Preview of upcoming shows - Portal 2 Spoilercast - Stage Select 2-2 - Gamepocalypse Onichanbara Bikini Samurai - Pre-E3 show
Emails and Outro
Like the show? Leave an iTunes review. Don't like the show? No respect...no respect!
Be sure to send us email: crashcast@gamecrashers.net
Peace...Out...

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.77 - Nintendo Neti Pot
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
On this Ep. of the 'cast' we poke fun at our own tardiness, Boris responds to our "prejudice" regarding the 3DS, and Jon introduces me to the scariest product I have ever seen.
The Rundown: I shamelessly plug the JTV stream (http://www.justin.tv/gamecrashers) Game of the Week: Portal 2, Epic Mickey, Mortal Kombat Hardware Review: Astro A30/Mixamp Professional Gaming Headset & Nintendo 3DS Stupid News: PSN is broken, Ridge Racer is gettting...unbounded?, and Nintendo's got a brand new console. Emails - including and intense rant on indie games and how the itunes feed ate two of our shows. Outro
Like the show? Leave an iTunes review. Don't like the show? Well there's just no hope for you, is there?
Be sure to send us email: crashcast@gamecrashers.net
Peace...Out...

item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
When a show just has to get going, it gets going. Whether you're here or not. But if you're going to crash your own podcast...this is the way to do it!
The Rundown: Game of the Week Stupid News Some dumb song with the word "Friday" in it Did you know that Saturday comes after? No Tweets or Emails this week Preview of upcoming shows Our throwdown challenge to the listners Outro-fantastic-amazing-fabuloso!
Like the show? Leave an iTunes review. Don't like the show? Well, we can't account for you not having taste.
Be sure to send us email: crashcast@gamecrashers.net
Peace...Out...

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.73 - Dragon Age Who?
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Unscripted, Uncut, Unfettered, and (mostly) un"flotzed" with. This episode we take the road less traveled and do a completely off-the-cuff episode sans show notes. Also Sean calls in from the old country via his cellphone.
THE RUNDOWN: - PAX East happens without us - Media vs Gamers @PAX - Guild Wars 2 thoughts - We talk MMO's past, present, and future and why Fantasy MMOs outnumber any other type of MMO - Stalker Complete mod - Homefront is 4 hours? - The videogame PR machine - Dragon Age II: if it ain't broke...why fix it? - Tweets of the week - Emails: Arcades and Nostalgia - Preview Ep.74, the Gamepocalypse, and the Stage Select
Like the show? Leave an iTunes review. Don't like the show? Well, you might need to get that checked.
Be sure to send us email: crashcast@gamecrashers.net
Peace...Out...

item.title: GameCrashers Ep. 72 - Four Loko Saves Lives
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Red Bull, Vodka, and (in another life) cigarettes are all that is saving Sean and me losing it completely. But 16 hour days be damned, we're putting out and giving you a show, albeit shorter than normal, but hey...don't say we never did anything for ya.
The Rundown: - We seriously fail at game of the week - I rant about how much the prospect of Activision buying 2K sucks for...everyone - We preview the next Gamepocalypse - Discuss upcoming PAX EAST shenanignas - Lose our grasp on reality entirely
Like the show? Leave an iTunes review. Don't like the show? Well, we can't help your parents dropping you on your head as a child.
Be sure to send us email: crashcast@gamecrashers.net
Peace...Out...

item.title: GameCrashers Ep. 70 - I see your 3DS and I raise you a PSP2
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
The new handheld war has begun, and you know what that means? Portable porn. Will people prefer it in 3D or with two analog 'sticks?' Neither rain, sleet, nor snow (or all three) will stop us from arguing about the 3DS vs the PSP2 (it's big enough to bludgeon a midget).
The Rundown: Game of the Week: Rob: Dead Space, Infinity Blade, Red Dead Redemption, Greed Corp Stupid News: - Gamestop lists PSP2 for $999 - Geohotz (PS3 hacker) ordered to turn over computers, flash cards, hard drives, and PS3s - Video Game Health Labeling Act: Round 2 Best Community "EVAR": Our forum responses Emails (email us a crashcast@gamecrashers.net)
If you're liking this show, please consider leaving an itunes review and/or subscribing. Also, be sure to check us out on Facebook, Twitter, and at our home base of operations at VGEVO.com!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.69 - 27 is NOT half of 69
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
In true GameCrashers fashion we continue all of the trends you've come to expect from us while simultaneously enlightening and offending the video game masses at small. Isn't it nice to know we're consistent?
The Rundown: - Game of the Week: DCU Online, The Witcher, Doom series, Medal of Honor, Fifa 11, Super Meat Boy, Minecraft, Trackmania Nations, and random PS1 games. - Stupid News returns - Most anticipated games of 2011 - listener responses to the game of the week - Emails delayed (we're sorry) - Preview of things to come - outro and peace out!
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Be sure to check out all the other network podcasts at VGEVO.com.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.68 - The 2nd Annual LIVE Crashstravaganza
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Another year has come and gone, so it is time for us to break out the Special Reserve, don our headsets, and beat the #&@^ out of each other as we decide which games from 2010 deserve all the credit and which ones deserve all the scorn.
This show was streamed live in front of a Ustream audience (1/8/11)
The Rundown: - The Rules - The Best of the Best - The Honorary Awards - The Dubious Awards - GAME OF THE YEAR!! - The Unusual Awards - 2011 predictions
Note: due to technical difficulties and my incredible knack at ripping the power strip out of the wall, one category from the list did not make the final recording (Best New Main Character). On the plus side, I think we've just about had all the snafus we need for a full year...yep.
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Be sure to check out all the other network podcasts at VGEVO.com.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.66 - This is a WOW Free Zone
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
With over 12 million players, WoW is a serious force to be reckoned with. But that doesn't amount to a whole hill o'beans in this world for Sean and Brian...and they're going to tell you why. Rob does what he can to defend it.
The Rundown: -EXTREME Game of the Week: --NBA2K11, Shatter, Bit.Trip Beat, Assassin's Creed II, World of Warcraft -Stupid News --IGN and Gamestop team up to get your money --Playswitch used game hub shuts it's (digital) doors -Question: What would it take to get you to play an MMO? -Mash-up Contest -Emails
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Be sure to check out all the other network podcasts at VGEVO.com.
Happy Holidays everyone! We'll see you back here on Ep.67

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.64 - 'Turkey Day' Must Haves
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
There's no denying it, the Holidays are now here. So you might as well find some awesome games to play while your in-laws stuff their faces with turkey and stuffing. We'll give you some of our must buys and a few we'll be picking up as well.
The Rundown: - Game of the Week: Kirby's Epic Yarn, Fallout: New Vegas, Castlevania Lord of Shadows - Do we pay to beta test games? - Dragon Age II. Is it really a sequel? - What you need to get on Black Friday - Sean and I take our first look back at 2010 (and a small look at 2011)
THE VIDEO GAME NAME MASH-UP CONTEST - Take two games, mash their names up, and write a short description of the new game. Submissions are open until the end of the month. Prize is the newest Borderlands DLC (PS3 code only).
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Be sure to check out all the other network podcasts at VGEVO.com.
Have a great Thanksgiving everyone! We'll see you back here on Ep.65 in two weeks.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.63 - Motion Sickness
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Bring along your dramamine and a disposable baggie because we are gonna Kintect and Move you into a whole other plane of video game existence. Use with caution. Allow one hour after a meal before operating. Small pieces may be dangerous to young kids.
The Rundown: - Game of the Week: Enslaved, Fable II, FF: Dissidia, Costume Quest, Fallout New Vegas, Super Meat Boy, Fallout & Fallout 2 - Boris is obsessed with talking about the "Abe" games - Boris and Brickman talk about the Move and the Kinect for quite a while - New Segment: PR-Overload! - We take a real, 24-hour break and lose two podcasters in the process

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.62 - Madness, Mayhem, and Meatboys
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Rob returns from an episode off, Jon brings the crazy, Dave brings the humor, and Brian brings the hurt. Super Meat Boy is gushed over, Extra Life is complete, zombies are all around, and Halloween is clearly having an effect on our brains. Mmm, brains!
The Rundown: Opening Rant: Enslaved is NOT racist! Game of the Week: Sonic Ep 1, Super Meat Boy, Dead Rising 2, VVVVVV, Fallout New Vegas (briefly) Extra Live Postmortem Discussion Topic: Scariest character in a game Emails...three of them...suck it! I'm off to go cruisin' - see ya'll at INDISFEST!!!
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.60 - LIVE from Monaco...and the End of the Universe!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
It's our first live show since E3. Clearly, we still have an issue with brevity. Joining us on this episode of the "cast" we have special guest Andy Schatz, the mind behind the indie title 'Monaco'. We also talk stealth games and take your skype calls!
Amazingly, Skype only plummets into a black hole four or five times during the broadcast. Which is a win for us!
The Rundown: - Minecraft hype is infectious...and unexpected - Hydrophobia is damn good fun - Brickman calls out "The Sterling" and "Destructoid" - Special Guest Andy Schatz answers our questions on Monaco (your questions, too) - Our awesome listeners and fellow podcasters 'crash' our show - We talk about our favorite (and less-than-favorite) 'Stealth Games' - Live show OUT!
Musical Breaks: Super Mario World, Mega Man, Front Mission, 007 Goldeneye, Mirror's Edge, MGS3 Snake Eater, Mega Man 2 (DnB Remix)
Special Music Info: Monaco - Composer: Kevin MacLeod
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Every little bit brings us closer to getting away with it (and getting out of Monaco alive).
item.itunes:subtitle: It's our first live show since E3. Clearly, we still have an issue with brevity. Joining us on this episode of the "cast" we have special guest Andy Schatz, the mind behind the indie title 'Monaco'. We also talk stealth games and take your skype calls!
item.itunes:summary:
It's our first live show since E3. Clearly, we still have an issue with brevity. Joining us on this episode of the "cast" we have special guest Andy Schatz, the mind behind the indie title 'Monaco'. We also talk stealth games and take your skype calls!
Amazingly, Skype only plummets into a black hole four or five times during the broadcast. Which is a win for us!
The Rundown: - Minecraft hype is infectious...and unexpected - Hydrophobia is damn good fun - Brickman calls out "The Sterling" and "Destructoid" - Special Guest Andy Schatz answers our questions on Monaco (your questions, too) - Our awesome listeners and fellow podcasters 'crash' our show - We talk about our favorite (and less-than-favorite) 'Stealth Games' - Live show OUT!
Musical Breaks: Super Mario World, Mega Man, Front Mission, 007 Goldeneye, Mirror's Edge, MGS3 Snake Eater, Mega Man 2 (DnB Remix)
Special Music Info: Monaco - Composer: Kevin MacLeod
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Every little bit brings us closer to getting away with it (and getting out of Monaco alive).

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.59 - Does EA look...like a bitch?!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
I'll tell you right now, I don't think EA does. But some CEO's are crazier than others. And the interwebs have been a-flurry with CEO v CEO controversy. Guess it wouldn't be the internet without it. We discuss that and more on this episode of GCRadio.
The Rundown: - Game of the Week (Including: Halo Reach, Metroid Other M, Civilization 5, VVVVVV) - The Redundant Story Contest gets a winner! - Stupid News: - B.Kotick attacks EA... and EA strikes back. - GoG joke falls flat, but we're still talking about GoG - Emails - Live Show Preview (Our Live Show is on Sunday, Oct. 3rd at 8pm EST) - Extra Life - and the best OUTRO ever!
Please subscribe on iTunes, follow us on Twitter, and check us out on Facebook. Every little bit brings us closer to our ultimate goal of world domination (which is vital for a military victory).

THE RUNDOWN: - Introductions & The Rules
- The Topics: - Dave: FPS innovations - Rob: Used Sales VS Prices - Brian: Story where its not needed - Jon: Achievements - Sean: Barcade and Arcades
- Thoughts on: Mafia II
- Contest Results: We read the submissions for the Your Audio Log contest and pick the winner!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.53 - We Know S%*t Games
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
We're back to a regular format show and have plenty of Games of the Week, Stupid News, and Forum Feedback to go around. Oh, and do we have some words to say about what are and are not s%*t games.
The Rundown Games of the Week: Starcraft II, Secret of Monkey Island I & II, Red Dead Redemption, Limbo, World of Warcraft, GTA IV, Alpha Protocol, Medal of Honor Beta, Zelda Twilight Princess, Desktop Dungeons
Stupid News: - Tekken X Street Fighter is not Namco VS Capcom - Lord British wins $28m suit against NCSoft - Michael Pachter predicts subscriptions for MWII, Black Ops, Starcraft II - R4 card is now illegal in UK - Jackson family pressures PvZ to redesign Thriller-like "Dancing Zombie"
Send your comments, questions, and/or responses to crashcast@gamecrashers.net

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.52 - Stupid Easy!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
In Super Easy Mode, this podcast will reward you for playing it at 2x speed. Just expect it to make only 1/2 as much sense.
The Rundown: - Boris is back, he's happy to see you, and, yes, that is a discussion topic in his pants. - Stupid News Update: Blizzard takes Real ID off the table: the reactions that shut Real ID down (for now) - Discussion Topic: What's the deal with Super Easy Modes in games? - We discuss the importance of easy, medium, hard, and super hard modes in games and field listener comments and responses.
Next Week's Discussion Topic: - What Game Attic eligible game or franchise deserves a big budget reboot, remake, or spiritual successor? - Think on that, you video game fanboys and girls and send your emails, thoughts, opinions, and responses to to CRASHCAST@GAMECRASHERS.NET

50 shows down, 50 shows to go!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.50 - E3 Wrap Up Part II
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
E3's over and we survived all three days of video game madness. Join us as, over the course of TWO podcasts we reflect on what kicked ass, what sucked ass, and what was altogether meh. It'll be fun. We promise!
On this EP: Crysis 2, Limbo, Fable III, Valkyria Chronicles II, Harry Potter, Ghost Recon: Future Soldier, Final Fantasy XIV, MindJack, Vanquish, Legend of Zelda, Killzone 3, Twisted Metal, Lost in Shadow, Sony Move, Motorstorm Apocalypse, Echochrome 2, Portal 2, Medal of Honor, DC Universe Online, Marvel vs Capcom III, Star Wars TFU, Star Wars TOR, and whatever else is worth talking about.
Plus questions from our USTREAM audience, two special, unexpected guests, and elation over making it to the 'effing' 1 YEAR MARK. Oh...yeah...baby!
And with that...E3 is up and outta here!

item.description:

Don't fret about the length of this short show. We'll be putting out way too many podcasts during "Three Week!"

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.45 - Stop the f**king presses
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Today our special guest Jon Barrickman helps us tackle the fall of print journalism, the death of used games, and how this industry thinks way too highly of itself (and takes itself way too seriously).
The Rundown: Game of the Week: Final Fantasy XIII, Yakuza 3, Fuel, The Humble Bundle Valve has a sense of humor A day at Metacritic Stupid News: Facebook to save PC Gaming? (Epic Games) EA's bid to kill used games Paying more for games Discussion Topic: Print vs Web - Physical vs Online Upcoming guests on GC
Update: so now Ubisoft is eyeing EA's pay model. It starts!

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.44 - REPLAY not RAPELAY!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Warning: This episode contains references within that may prove to be too funny for some. You may even find yourself laughing hysterically at how many lines we can cross in one episode. Turn back now...you have been warned!!!
On this episode of GameCrashers we delve into places and topics that most video game podcasts have the good sense to steer clear of. But we didn't learn those lessons in congeniality school...in fact we missed those classes altogether. (stay in school, kids).
THE RUNDOWN: - Game of the Week: MLB2K10, MGS4, Starcraft II Beta, Darksiders, Deadly Premonition - Famitsu controversy - $49 versus $59 for PC games - Ephemeral? Etherial? E Pluribus Unum!? - Discussion Topic: Replay Value in video games - Listener Responses - Emails - Lost: Via Domus (and why it exists) - GameCrashers: A History - Why MegaMan and I are not on speaking terms - And some casual conversations we'd probably be better off forgetting (but decided to record for a podcast o.O)
We apologize for everything we've said, everything we're saying currently, and everything we'll most like say henceforth. We appreciate your business. Try the veal.

item.title: GameCrashers Ep.42 - Proxy Hertler
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Two weeks off and we're finally back to our old shenanigans. It feels good to be back. Rob, Jason, and Dave spend way too much time talking about our games of the week and wrap the show up with a 3-part stupid news/discussion topic cross-over.
The Rundown: Game of the Week: - Left 4 Dead, Left 4 Dead 2, Dragon Age, X-Com, Jagged Alliance 2, Audiosurf, Borderlands, Darksiders, Stranglehold, Prototype, Deadly Premonition, and more Discussion Topics: - Sony implements 3D into firmware, but with a catch - DarkSydePhil problems on Youtube, Ubisoft cries foul - X-Com, the FPS? Future Shows: - Outtake Ep.43 - Future Guests (we hope) - QI the GameCrashers show
He is not the Hertler you know...he is...Proxy Hertler

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.40 - So long PAX EAST, Hello E3!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
In an attempt to resolve the issues from last week's show, we do the live 'thang' one more time, slay the PAX EAST demon once and for all, field a bunch of skype calls, and make our first predictions on E3 2010.
The Rundown: Impressions on APB, Mafia II, and last thoughts on PAX EAST We get skype called from Bad76, Zvarri, GooSau, Torgo, and Paul O'hara We discuss a whole range of tangents and odd topics Our hopes and dreams for E3 2010 Current status of the Gamepocalypse We finally figure out how to give two APB shirts away Discussion Topic for next week: The evolution of the video game cinematic
CONTEST: APB Shirt giveaway We have talked about a lot of games that were at PAX. The List: Shank, Red Dead Redemption, Joe Danger, Crackdown 2, AAAA a reckless disregard for gravity, Split Second, Metro 2033, Sid Meier's Civ 5, Scrap Metal, Prince of Persia the Forgotten Sands, Puzzle Quest II, Splinter Cell Conviction, Mafia II, and APB.
The Challenge: come up with a title from any two of the above listed games and create a new game of either a funny, wacky, cool, awesome, or strange nature. The two best selections will win an APB t-shirt available only at PAX EAST.
Send your submissions to theblog@gamecrashers.net by Noon EST on Sunday April 11th, 2010.

item.title: GameCrashers PAXEAST Day 2
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
As seen LIVE on Ustream, we recap the crazy events from day two of PAXEAST as well as celebrate our induction into the VGEVO podcast network. Oh yeah, we get a bit drunk, too.
The Rundown: More and More games More interviews, More problems with big crowds and rampant crowding More disappointments, More surprises More technical difficulties And more PAX!!
We want to thank VGEVO for bringing us onboard and giving us the opportunity to be part of the Network of Podcasts. But don't worry...we'd never sell out (pulls out a stack of hundreds and starts counting).
Stay tuned next week as we have our wrap-up show for PAX EAST. We discuss the last full day of the show, we give our final assessment of the inaugural Beantown PAX, we talk about the Post-Pax Stupid News, and we'll be doing the whole thing LIVE! That's right. Our last PAX show will be live, Sunday night at 8pm EST. We'll be trying, one more time, to take some calls from our awesome audience. Don't miss it!

item.title: GameCrashers PAXEAST Day 1
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
The first day of PAXEAST is behind us. We're exhausted, we're relieved, and we're full of PAX knowledge that we're going to share with you...because we love you.
The Rundown: The vibe at PAX The layout of the event Panel Problems And games, games, games: APB, Shank (Klei), Joe Danger (Hello Gameas), Eyefinity (ATI), Puzzle Quest II (D3P), Split Second (Disney Interactive), Crazy Otto (hacked Pacman), Classic and Console gaming booth. The Alienware booth nukes our interview with loudness NVIDIA future of PC Gaming panel
We also preview what we're going to see on day 2 as well as reflect on our high and low points of the first day of the show.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.38 - Audio Herpes
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Didn't you listen to your sex-ed teachers in high school? Never go into a GameCrashers podcast without some form of protection. We think the BFG works quite nicely. Zvarri from OtC Reviews joins the GC crew for a romp through "sameness" in video games.
The Rundown: Zvarri's game of the week: Mega Man Maverick Hunter X, Ace Attorney Investigations, DSi XL QotW: What IS the Question of the Week? - Has innovation in video games dried up? Pax East 2010 - PAX? In Boston?
Aaaaaaaand: The LIVE SHOW from Pax East 2010!!! Our live show will be airing on Saturday, March 27th 2010 at 9:30pm EST. We'll be transmitting via Ustream and we encourage all of you guys to come join us...for a very special announcement! Mark your calender, it's going to be a helluvah good time.
And yes, Jason, I know what Highlights for Children is...I just don't read it anymore...(pulls out hidden copy from beneath his jacket)...joy!!!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.37 - Move it, a$$hole!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
GDC is over and the 'move' has been tested. Well, not by us, but by those other 'journalists'. What do we think of it? Well, you'll have to listen to the show to find out. Also, we talk about a collection of games containing Roman Numerals, we argue about the importance of unlockables, Boris attempts to rationalize "casual racism", and Jason, Brian, and I try to figure out why games are so damn hard to finish these days.
The Rundown: Game of the Week: Final Fantasy XIII, Batman AA (PC), Mega Man X Gamepocalypse Ep.2 Preview - Jumper: Griffin's Story Discussion Topic: PS3 "Move" and OnLive Emails Blur Beta Key Contest: Write us an Itunes review and win a Blur Beta Key! (thanks WarriorSCP3) Live Show @PAX dated (and will probably be changed again) Outro
Welcome to PSWiiHD nation. Please dump your conventional controller at the door and pick up your 'move' stick and sub-vibrator. Please do not recharge while in use.
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to PSWiiHD nation. Please dump your conventional controller at the door and pick up your 'move' stick and sub-vibrator. Please do not recharge while in use. And make sure you strap the thing on.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.36 - Valve's a Mac
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Yes, we know about what happened at Infinity Ward. Of course we haven't overlooked Brickfest2010. But, seriously, Steam games on the Mac? Portal 2!? A new ending to Portal 1?!?! These things cannot be ignored.
The Rundown: - We read gamers responses to Jason's "Alan Wake" article - The Stupid News: - Activision ousts Infinity Ward heads Zampella and West - Reaction to ApocalyPS3. - Valve tweaks end of Portal 1, announces Portal 2 and Mac Support - Emails and Comments - Game of the week: - Heavy Rain, Battlefield Bad Company 2, Mega Man 9, Dante's Inferno, Stalker Shadow of Chernobyl, Bayonetta
Also, Final Fantasy XIII is out this week. As such, the musical breaks for this episode include some of our favorite battle themes from the entirety of the series.
Next week: the "Slashrospective!" - a look back at the God of War series, the brawlers, beat'em'ups, hack'n'slashes, and more that created the genre, as well as GoW's place in it.
Bon Appetite!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.35 - Select your Joystick
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
Alright, we won't lie. Last week really sucked. Between a stomach virus, 25 inches of snow, and lots of "real job" work, the podcast simply had no chance. But we're back, and ready to tackle ep.35 with all we've got. GRAB YOUR JOYSTICKS!
The Rundown: - Game of the Week: Super Meat Boy, Mass Effect 2, Heavy Rain, White Knight Chronicles, Fifty Cent Blood on the Sand - Resuls of the Gamepocalypse Poll - Email Question Our thoughts on video game controllers, their evolution, and the good, bad, and ugly. - The Stupid News - Outro Previews of Episode 36 and 37
Also, due to the length of this episode we'll be releasing some "bonus content" in a .5 episode later in the week. Stay tuned!

item.title: Gamepocalypse Ep.1 - Leisure Suit Larry: BOB
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Radio
item.description:
After a very, very, VERY long delay, Sean is back from the edge of personal sanity to bring you his thoughts on the grand turd of them all: Leisure Suit Larry Box Office Bust. Don't say we didn't warn you.
Stay tuned for Sean's written review on Gamecrashers.net and head to the site to vote on which game he should play next. We'll get that podcast out as soon as Sean's through it. Let the mayhem being!!!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.34 - Alan Wake hates on the PC
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
So the PC is too intimate for you, eh Alan? So you think you can't be all moody and depressed anywhere except a living room flat-screen TV? Well, Jason doesn't buy your shenanigans, Microsoft! Rob and Dave are forced to agree (it's in our contract).
The Rundown: Rob screws up the date...again A very brief Game of the Week We allude to the Gamepocalypse Alan Wake axed on PC, excuse feels contrived One Console Future: Listener Reactions - OnLive, Competition, New Consoles, Cloud Gaming, Boxed copies Dave loses his train of thought...several times, in fact.
A short show for a short week. Don't miss the first episode of the Gamepocalypse and the special "cross over" episode later this week!
Check out http://ocremix.org for more great video game remixes like the ones featured in this week's episode.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.30.5 - The Outtakes
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
Thirty episodes in. It's high time we unleashed some insanity on the "internets". Here's a full hour of some of the zaniest moments from eps 13-22. We can't guarantee that it will make sense, but we do hope you'll laugh your asses off at our behalf.
No rundown this show, just a collection of segments that were never used and have yet to be heard by the podcast world. Musical breaks are brought to you by the very talented Judson Cowan, aka Tettix/Cecada. You can find his full list of music (99% free of charge) at www.tettix.net
This is our special gift to you guys for listening to the show, for leaving itunes reviews, for emailing us, and for sticking with us this far. Let's hope we got a lot more episodes in us cause we're having a blast!
Feel free to follow us on twitter @Gamecrashers, send us emails at theblog@gamecrashers.net, and leave us itunes reviews at our itunes page.

item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
You crazy people and your 3D. In the GameCrashers Universe we have 5D's...all of which require 7 optical implants, 4 sets of glasses, 3 tvs with picture in picture, and a giant bottle of scotch! Rob, Dave, Brian and Sean tackle the CES 10 million dollar question: What is the craze with 3D and will it take off?
The Rundown: Game of the Week Sean preps to play Leisure Suit Larry: BoB We discuss all the forms of 3D The Stupid News Returns
A little later than we planned, but we age well.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.28 - It's the Live "Crashstravaganza!"
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers Live
item.description:
As experts of drinking and blathering about video games at the same time, we kick off 2010 by recording our inaugural episode of the year live. Booze is consumed, cheese cake is enjoyed, and the four GC horsemen pick their GOTY.
The Rundown - What games did you close out 2009 playing? - What games of 2009 were you unable to get to? - Game of the Year for 2009 - Listener predictions for 2010 - Our predictions for 2010 - Most anticipated games of 2010 - Best year of the decade - Best franchise of the decade - The "Wacky" awards (round 2) - New Years Resolutions
This 'three hour tour' is the only one you need to start your new year off right.
QotW for ep.29: what game from the last decade will you still be playing in this decade?

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.27 - Best and Worst of 'Aught-Nine'
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
We made it to the end of the year! Is someone recording this? For our last show of 2009, Dave, Rob, and Jason trudge through the best and worst of the year to give you their 'awesome-est' damn podcast yet. Stuff that in your stocking! Happy Holidays!
The Rundown: The Best and the Worst of 2009 Note: Game of the Year was held at gunpoint, robbed, beat up, and left for dead in front of an ATM in Utah (who gets robbed in Utah? They don't even DRINK THERE!). Expect it to return on the Live show Jan. 3rd, 2010. Preshow starts at 6:30pm EST, Live show starts @ 7:00 EST.
Don't miss it. Missing our live show will cause an angel to have his wings chopped off, lose his job, find out his wife is cheating on him, cause him to start drinking again, and eventually result in his throwing himself off a bridge. Do you really want to be saddled with that kind of responsibility?
Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.26 - God of 'Dante's Inferno'
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
So how much like GoW is it? Dave gives us his first impressions of the demo. Also I gush over the greatness that is Torchlight, Sean avoids talking about Grim Fandango, and Brian stays classy. Just leave the tip on the counter before you leave.
The Rundown: Game of the Week: Torchlight, Dante's Inferno Demo (Scythe versus Dual Swords), Grim Fandango, System Shock 2 Is Half Life Episode 3 ever coming out? David informs the rest of us what a Thai Slush (yeah, I've never heard of it either) The Stupid News: - Healthcare providers offer virtual cash to derail healthcare bill - Michael Atkinson responds to Aliens Vs Predator being denied classification - David Jaffe thinks fighting the Australian Govt. on ratings is a losing battle - Our response to 'Sheep Man' in Mega Man X
Yep, another short show. But next week is our Best of/Worst of 2009 show. It should be our grandest show yet (another way of saying a nightmare to edit!) Send us an email at theblog@gamecrashers.net telling us what your best game and most disappointing game of 2009 were. We'll read it on the next show. Until then, Happy Holidays!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.25 - The Lo Mein Edition
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Mmm, nothing beats Chinese food around the holidays. A little sweet and sour chicken, some fried rice, and some box wine make for one hell of a yule tide cheer. Tis the season to look back on some of our best, and worst, holiday memories.
The Rundown: Responses from Ep.24 Question of the Week: Best/Worst video game holiday memories Preview of Best of and End of the Year Show Preview of Sean's new segment: Starting off on the Wrong Foot!
It's a short show this week, but it's filled with double the amount of sarcasm and wit to make up for it. Hey, we love you guys (in a totally a-sexual kind of way).

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.24 - The End is Nigh: A look at the games of Q1 2010
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Because we didn't spend enough money on games in 2009, Rob, Dave, Jason, and Sean spend some time looking at the games that will own our lives in the new year. Plus we talk about some other useless stuff.
The Rundown: - Sean's Retro Review of American McGee's Alice - Dave talks about 3d gaming: then and now - Rob gives a preview of Assassin's Creed 2 - Sean gets called out by a listener - We discuss our most surprisingly good games of 2009 - And last, but not least, we take a look at next year's Q1 releases
So many games, so little time!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.23 - Ultimate Turkey Day Rumble
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Turkey day is here! Can you friggin believe it? The year is almost over and the number of games coming out at the same time is too overwhelming for words. But we here at GameCrashers were born for this kind of pressure. Best of all, the 'Voltron' five, Rob, Jason, Dave, Brian, and Sean, are all in attendance and on one Skype call. Yes, we're pretty sure it's the making of an "end of the world" scenario.
The Rundown: - Emails, blog posts, and topic responses - We reintroduce ourselves to the new listeners - Game(s) of the Week: Myst (PSP), Battlefield Bad Company 2 beta (Preview), Dragon Age: Origins (360), New Super Mario Bros. Wii, Crysis (PC) - QotW: We discuss a controversial new study on video games - The Stupid Video Game News
Plus there's some other crazy stuff we're sure is taboo in at least 40 states.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.22 - Limping across the finish line!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
With one cohost recovering from a hangover and another recovering from 2nd degree burns, the surviving members of GameCrashers, Rob, Brian, and Boris, gather up their last bit of strength to bring this derailed locomotion all the way into the station.
This week on GameCrashers: - Modern Warfare 2 cold cocks us in the face - We continue to gush over Borderlands - Brian finally joins the future and plays Call of Duty 4 - Question of the Week: Can certain games, like certain films, be SO bad they're good? - Stupid News of the World - We spend way too much examining the "blow by blow" in Ring King - And much more!
It's a mad mad mad mad mad mad world!

item.title: GameCrashers - EP.21 - Modern Warfare 2...it's "Call of Duty"!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Showing up one host short, Dave, Rob, Brian, and Jason go back in time to remember our favorite moments from previous entries in the COD franchise. And before the podcast is over, one of us will fall through a black hole. Who will it be?
But wait, there's more!
The Rundown: - Question of the Week: Favorite underrated arcade game - Venezuela hates games almost as much as it hates gamers - Reggie Fils-Aime destroys all hope for WiiHD - MW2 cyber-theif arrested in Miami-Dade county - Ubisoft tells German magazine: no good review, no review copy - EA cuts more jobs, games
And remember kids, putting Steam into "offline mode" saves lives!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.20 - What Would Zombie Jesus Do: Halloween Edition
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
On this episode of GameCrashers, the flummoxed-five take on ghoulies, ghosties, and the zombie apocalypse to bring you the best damn halloween video game podcast ever. Join us as we share some of our favorite scary gaming moments.
The Rundown: - Scary Video Game Moments! - - What makes a video game scary? (or not) - - Why pirates and forum trolls ruin it for the rest of us -
The (Stupid) News - Micro-transactions coming to Fable III - Left 4 Dead 2 denied classification in Australia, again - Sid Meier brings Civ to facebook, ruins more lives - Father slays son in drunken search for video game - Zealous Christian website preaches the dangers of video games, then laughs at us!
Musical Breaks Bioshock System Shock 2 Condemned
By the way, what would Zombie Jesus do?

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.18 - We need a Hero!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
On this episode of GCR, Sean and Rob wade through a video game news drought in the hopes of finding a few golden gaming nuggets among a sea of bile. Bring a towel, cause this could get ugly.
Topics include: - Game of the Week: Final Thoughts on Batman Arkham Asylum, Spider Man Web of Shadows (Yes. Again!), Clive Barker's Jericho - Topic of the Week: Is the importance of the Single Player experience being replaced by Multiplayer/Co-op? - The NEWS - Web of Shadows developer Shaba Studios closed by Activision - "The Flash" game shut down 6 months into development - Massive GM explains that gamers actually like ads - Gamespot "All Time Greatest Hero" contest comes to a close...with questionable results. - As well as references to Heavy Rain, Dragon Age Origins, Bioshock 2, Uncharted 2, and Brutal Legend
Also note: Uncharted 2 and Brutal Legend are out TODAY! So go get em, cause we'll be talking about them on next week's show.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.17 - Bobby Kotick hates fun...and midgets
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Yes, we couldn't believe it either! How does one hate fun and midgets? Can you seriously have one without the other? Rob, Jason, and Brian don't think so. And boy are they ready to prove it to you!
Topics on this week's podcast: - Game of the Week "Extended Edition" - Half Life 2, Plants versus Zombies, Street Fighter 4, Mass Effect, Prototype, X-Men Origins: Wolverine - Uncharted 2 Reviews: Will this game sell PS3s? - TGS '09 disappoints: are there too many conventions? - Bobby Kotick thinks game developers need to serious the "F" up! - Gabe Newell is going to Australia! - The PSPGo vs the PSP-3000 - Virtual-Boy: Worst Portable System? Is it even portable? - Brad Wardell changes his POV on GFW

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.16 - Games, games, and more games
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description: Autumn is right around the corner, which means we're all about to get bombarded by a torrential downpour of awesome games. Rob, Dave, Jason, and Brian attempt to wade through the list of 2009 titles and talk about the best of the bunch. Hang on to your hats, cause there's only one way out of this mo'fo! The short list of discussed games: Halo 3 ODST, Scribblenauts, Need for Speed: Shift, Saw, Gran Turismo PSP, Borderlands, Alpha Protocol, DJ Hero, Brutal Legend, Dragon Age: Origins, Lego Rock Band, Blur, Fifa 10, Modern Warfare 2, Left 4 Dead 2, Assassin's Creed 2, Avatar, This is Vegas, AC: Bloodlines, Saboteur, Gran Turismo 5, Forza 3, Uncharted 2, All Points Bulletin, Serious Sam HD, Starcraft 2 Plus we make a few GOTY predictions. Break Theme: Sweeping Scores (Panzer Dragoon, Zelda Twilight Princess, Eternal Sonata, Okami, and Shadow of the Colossus) You want games? Heck, we got'em in spades! claim-my-podcast-in-podbean{scid-Z2FtZWNyYXNoZXJz-ecid}

item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
In a show with all the technical problems of a three ring circus of midgets on crystal meth, Rob, Brian, Jason, and Sean content with a perfect storm of patience fraying computer issues in order to discuss the following video game topics.

It's not perfect, but hey...it's the best we could afford

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.14 - PAX: the cure to convention withdrawl
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
For our longest, most troublesome podcast yet, Rob and Dave welcome Brian back to the podcast and attempt to inject some professionalism into the podcast. Sadly, that attempt was sacked for more @$*# and fart jokes (because they're still funny)
Game of the week: Batman Arkham Asylum, Indigo Prophecy/Fahrenheit, Killer 7
Topics include: - The outsider list of cool PAX stuff - Question of the Week: How will people respond to "Gay Tony" - Team Fortress 2 devs are annoyed with cheaters - Gamer sues Microsoft over disc scratching drive - Rockstar finally pays for it's "Coffee" - FCC clarifies it's Cool with ESRB - Harmony Gold orders Mechwarrior Reboot a "Cease and Desist" - God of War and sequel get a Blu-Ray 720p makeover
Music Theme: Reboots, Remakes, and Throwbacks
Please help us, we know not what we are doing!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.13 - The Successful Failure
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Some think thirteen is an unlucky number, going so far as to deny it from being a floor in most buildings. But here at GameCrashers Rob and Dave are convinced that the number thirteen will be the best podcast yet. Please humor them.
Topics we discuss this week:
- Game of the week: Persona 3 / Shadow Complex (cont.) / Nights (Wii) - Question of the Week: The next generation of MMOs - Screw Orson Scott Card, Buy Shadow Complex - The crazy release schedule - Proof that bundles are nor guaranteed to rock - Naughty Dog insists Uncharted 2 won't work on the 360 - Crafty players cause EVE bank severe headaches - ESA says 'no thanks' to FCC universal rating system
Break Theme: PC GAMES!! (Crusader: No Remorse, Unreal, and NOLF!)
By the way, could you hold this black cat while I close this ladder that's setup over broken glass? khxbye!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.12 - Quakecon and Gamescom and Blizzcon, oh my!
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
Because good help is hard to keep, Rob goes it solo this episode and discusses the latest news from both GamesCom and Blizzcon. Now with 75% less bull$hit.
Topics on the show include:
- Games of the week: Trials HD and Shadow Complex - GamesCom 2009: Attendance numbers, The Whispered World, Dark Void Delay excuses, No Multiplayer for PSP LBP, Twenty Minutes of SW: TOR on IGN, PS3 slim is real, Fable III announced - BlizzCon 2009: Diablo III Monk Class revealed, Blizz denies that LAN is important, Chris Metzen announces WoW: Cataclysm. - Cake is had by all (wait...that's not an actual topic. Dave, get out of my topic list!!!)
As for the rumors, they're all true (no comment).
Correction: I mention that BlizzCon was happening in Seattle. Well, that's not true. It actually took place in Anaheim, CA.

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.11 - Blast Processing FTW
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
On this episode of GameCrashers Sean, Dave, and Rob walk a fine line between hilarity and absurdity, which is not that much different from every other show. We also reflect on the Sega Genesis 20th anniversary and the Doom 4 announcement.
Other Topics include: - Games of the Week: Valkyria Chronicles, Robot Alchemic Drive, Tomb Raider Anniversary PSP, Final Fantasy Dissidia - Free marketing for Playswitch.com - Hillary: First Blood Flash Game - No Elder Scrolls 5? - PS3 Slim pre GamesCom announcement - Rumors on price drops for Sony

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.10 - Better late than never
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
We aim to please here at GameCrashers home base. As such, we've released a podcast of such a high quality, even our detractors would say "we've gone as far as we can." Sadly, that doesn't bode well for Episode 11. Oh well.
Topics and games on this weeks episode: - Lost Odyssey, Batman and Robin (PS1), Shatter, Fat Princess, Batman: Arkham Asylum Demo, Jagged Alliance 2, Wii Sports Resort - The controversy over "America's Army Experience" - WoW censorship in China - Therapists sign up to help people in WoW - The Sims 3 Patch notes - Activision settles Lawsuit with Activision
Music Break Theme: Shin Megami Tensei series/spinoffs
P.S. - We're sorry. We'll never be late again. Also, please support us/sign up for Extra Life!

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.9 - Quake Live Unifies
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
For our final podcast in the single digits, Jason, Dave, Rob, and new guest host Sean dive deep into the mire of games they've played to bring you the strangest Game of the Week session yet. And for some reason, Jason and Dave insist on playing Quake Live during several parts of the recording, making their comments even less reliable than usual.
Topics we discuss on the show:
- Fallout 3, Battlefield 1943, Prototype, Super Mario Bros. 3, Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy, Quake Live, Unreal Tournament - Double fine Countersues Activision - Beyond Good & Evil 2 speculation creates more speculation. - Town deadlocked on renewal of video game license for a Chuck E. Cheese - ESA sues CTA for banning video game posters on Chicago buses - Unreal Tournament 3 developer Epic Games says "don't expect a new UT any time soon"
It's all fun and games until someone rocket jumps your face.
Break Theme: Dreamcast Games

item.title: GameCrashers - Ep.7
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
This week on GameCrashers radio, Soundtrack burns a hole in the space time continuum that is so deep it destroys our first attempt at recording Ep 7 and causes one of our guest hosts to disintegrate before our very eyes. What's left is a collection of impatient, groggy, and battered podcasters who muster up whatever strength they have left to deliver up the mediocrity you're about to enjoy. Hey, at least we aim high.
Topics we discuss and speculate on:
- Game of the Week: Fallout 3, Final Fantasy X-2, Ghostbusters, Ratchet & Clank Future, Paper Mario - Do videogames need violence to tell compelling stories? - Will Apple ban drug dealing game - Midway bought by WB, RIP Midway - Miracle on the Hudson flash game played 4.6 million times - Eidos commits PR Sepiku regarding Batman: Arkham Asylum
And yes, I mispronounce Shenmue several times during this podcast. Would you like a tissue?
Break Theme: Street Fighter Series

item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
A day late and a dollar short, the GameCrashers podcast team returns from E3 less than refreshed and jump head first into the post-expo detritus. As you can see by the length, all good intentions went horribly bad.
The topic list includes:
- Games Played: Uncharted MP, Infamous/Prototype, Red Faction: Guerrilla, Patapon 2, Peggle on iphone, and more - EA's staged Dante's Inferno protest backfires - Double Fine sued by Activision - Mirror's Edge 2 gets multiplayer - Darksider's Jan. 1st release date - Crackdown 2 teaser and thoughts - ESA wants ESRB to rate iphone games - and more
One toke over the line, you poor fool? Wait til you see those damn bats!

item.title: E3 Expo - Day 3 Review
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
As the crowds begin to disperse and the booth babes take their last photo in their scantly clad shorts and skirts, we return back to the crasher-cave to record one more chockd-full-o-nuts podcast. The last day is always the hardest day because youre struggling to fit every little last bit of expo into your mind before you pack your bags and go home. But I think weve done the impossible. So join us as we go through the last day in video game paradise, the ups and the downs, as well as our picks for E3 2009 best of show with returning special guest host Dave Orosz of Disney Interactive.
What were covering: - Brutal Legend - Project Cube - Warriors Orrochi 2 - Soul Calibur PSP - Final Fantasy Dissidia - Aragorns Quest for DS/Wii - Wet - Scribblenauts - Ruse - Best and worst of E3 day 3 - Best of Show - E3 2009
Plus special shout-outs to Homer Rabara and Ryan MacDonald of Gamespot.com as well as the independent game showings and our thoughts on Natal and PS3 motion control.
item.itunes:subtitle: As the crowds begin to disperse and the booth babes take their last photo in their scantly clad shorts and skirts, we return back to the crasher-cave to record one more chockd-full-o-nuts podcast.
item.itunes:summary:
As the crowds begin to disperse and the booth babes take their last photo in their scantly clad shorts and skirts, we return back to the crasher-cave to record one more chockd-full-o-nuts podcast. The last day is always the hardest day because youre struggling to fit every little last bit of expo into your mind before you pack your bags and go home. But I think weve done the impossible. So join us as we go through the last day in video game paradise, the ups and the downs, as well as our picks for E3 2009 best of show with returning special guest host Dave Orosz of Disney Interactive.
What were covering: - Brutal Legend - Project Cube - Warriors Orrochi 2 - Soul Calibur PSP - Final Fantasy Dissidia - Aragorns Quest for DS/Wii - Wet - Scribblenauts - Ruse - Best and worst of E3 day 3 - Best of Show - E3 2009
Plus special shout-outs to Homer Rabara and Ryan MacDonald of Gamespot.com as well as the independent game showings and our thoughts on Natal and PS3 motion control.
item.itunes:keywords: E3, day 3, best of e3, thoughts, media, ending

item.title: E3 Expo - Day 2 Review
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers
item.description:
With a new day comes a new hall: South Hall that is. With almost double the number of the booths and a plethora of games to be played, Dave and I had our hands full. Clocking in at a little over two hours, Ep. 2 of our free-range style podcast covers the following:
- Prototype - Dead Space Extraction - Red Steel 2 - Forza 3 - Darksiders - King of Fighters - Bayonetta - Split Second - Pixel Junk Shooter - Angry Dantes Inferno/EA protesters - Mini Ninjas - Impressions of South Hall - And our surprises and disappointments of day two!
Pull up a chair, this round is on us.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gamecrashers.net calls down the fury of E3 day two and lives to tell the tale. With special guest David Orosz of Disney Interactive Studios returning for another episode.

item.title: E3 Expo - Day 1 Review
item.itunes:author: GameCrashers.net
item.description:
The first day of the E3 is in the can. We saw a lot of awesome things, played some amazing demos and betas, and ran into a few famous members of the video gaming community. And were going to talk about it allright here, right now. So grab a chair and lets get down to business. On the podcast today my good friend Dave Orosz from Disney Interactive joins me to discuss all the things we saw today in the West Hall. The topics include:
- Uncharted MP - M.A.G. - Batman Arkham Asylum - Fat Princess - Tony Hawk: Ride - Blur - Fight Night Round 4 - Torchlight - Tatsunoko VS Capcom - God of War III - Our impressions of the West Hall - Hands on time with the PSP Go and Gran Turismo Portable - The good and bad of day one
So sit back and enjoy the show!
